I just think this AI vs non-ai has overcomplicated what art is. If someone looks at something and finds artistic value in it, then it's art. 

AI is a tool like anything else, and depending on how tools are used is what makes the difference.

But to be literal, the meriam Webster definition of art is "the conscious use of skill and creative imagination especially in the production of aesthetic objects". If a human lazily uses AI to generate images, it wouldn't, by definition, be art since the "skill" aspect is missing. But if intention, skill, and creativity are involved significantly in the creation, then it would, by definition, be art.
What happened to "art is in the eye of the beholder"?

Only 1-2 pinks for the entire match? I think you should be using a pink AT LEAST for every objective fight. So for a full match that reaches endgame, that would be 5 pinks for drakes, 1 pink for the 2nd herald, and probably 2 pinks for 2 barons. That's 8 right there, and thats not even including regular vision denial during laning phase.
Sweeper and umbral still can't do what pink wards do. For example, placing a pink ward while fighting drake safely prevents the enemy team from getting vision on drake.

I honestly don't even know anymore when the best time to throw E out. I'm so comfortable with morde, I play him on autopilot and I just know small micro movements that cue for the best time to E. Idk, hard to explain lol.

I almost never bring to because I'm too aggressive of a player and would rather have exhaust or ignite to help me win duels. I also never bring flash, anymore, because ghost is so much better. I do miss flash+q tho a lot.

I used to use conq or grasp, depending what build I wanted to go and who I was fighting, but lately I've been getting AMAZING results with lethal tempo + jaksho. Can build whatever else you want after that. I think it's a common misconception that morde needs conq. Players just need to play around the runes they bring. Morde is a lot more versatile than players give him credit for.

Even if you int pre 6, I feel like you still win at 6. 

I don't feel like it's talked about that much, but I always bring ohse rush against kiting champs like Teemo, GP, gnar, etc. It changes everything. You literally just run those champs over. You're sacrificing a little bit of dmg but at the same time you're not because I'm sure you know the value of mobility.

Agreed. Lord is just a nice, cheaper skin.

That's probably true about his E. I just feel that his E, regardless of the skin, is easy to dodge IF the enemy is looking for it. Similarly, you'll land your E, regardless of the skin, if the enemy isn't looking for it. In ranked, I can understand why those extra smaller details would matter to players.

Yea man, high noon is solid. The chromas are too. But I always have to look the chromas up on YouTube because the client's representation of them is impressively bad.

I'm with you! Lethality is fun and all, but I hate being squishy. I've had the most success with only building items with both AD and Health. Spear of Shojin has become a core item for me. I think people are forgetting maiden and ghouls scale off of health too. Yea, the ghouls can be one shot with auto attacks but not everyone can auto them quickly. Also I've seen maiden 1v1 people just because of all the hp it had. It sucks watching a jg just smite all of maiden's hp.

That's how it should be. I like it when I actually want to rotate between skins. Unlike Pyke, where all of his skins are amazing, but every new skin he gets is easily better than the last. And I feel like I HAVE to use the newest skin, lol. Personal problem though I'm sure.

I was so excited for Ashen, but was kinda underwhelmed by it when it came out. I LOVE the model when he ults, but that's about it. Definitely the best ult model out of all of skins. But in terms of the overall skin, I feel like High Noon, Project, Pentakill 3, and Dark Star are better.
Glad I'm not the only that still uses Lord Mordekaiser. The passive is dope with the lightning in it.

The small gameplay advantages/disadvantages are never enough for me to choose one skin over another. I just don't care that much. I'm definitely picking a skin for the fantasy. Speaking of high noon, I THINK it's my favorite skin at the moment.
